removals.replacement: tmp[i * n + j] + B[k * n + j] * A[i * n + k]
removals.reasoning: Outer parentheses around the sum and around the product are redundant; operator precedence (* over +) ensures the same evaluation order, and subscript parentheses are unnecessary.
Parentheses inside the array subscript are unnecessary; * binds tighter than +.

removals.expression: (((beta * C[(i * n + j)]) + ((alpha * B[(i * n + j)]) * A[(i * n + i)])) + (alpha * tmp[(i * n + j)]))
removals.replacement: beta * C[i * n + j] + alpha * B[i * n + j] * A[i * n + i] + alpha * tmp[i * n + j]
removals.reasoning: All grouping parentheses are redundant because * has higher precedence than +; removing them clarifies the linear combination without changing semantics. Subscript parentheses are also unnecessary.
Parentheses are unnecessary in a relational expression; < has lower precedence than -, so k < m - 1 is unambiguous and clearer.
Parentheses inside the array subscript are unnecessary; * binds tighter than +.

removals.replacement: C[k * n + j] + alpha * B[i * n + j] * A[i * n + k]
removals.reasoning: Outer parentheses around the sum and the inner product are redundant due to operator precedence; subscript parentheses are also unnecessary.
